What does the `getreservedeposits` command do in Verus?

The `getreservedeposits` command returns all deposits under the control of a specified currency or chain. If the currency is from an external system or chain, all deposits will be under the control of that system or chain only, not its independent currencies.

getreservedeposits "currencyname" (returnutxos) Returns all deposits under control of the specified currency or chain. If the currency is of an external system or chain, all deposits will be under the control of that system or chain only, not its independent currencies. Arguments 1. "currencyname"    (string, required)    full name or i-ID of controlling currency 2. "returnutxos"    (bool, optional)     if true, returns a UTXO list and currency values on each Result:  {   "utxos" : {utxo and currency values},    if returnutxos == true, else null   "currency 1 i-address" : value,   "currency 2 i-address" : value,  } Examples: > verus getreservedeposits "currencyname" > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getreservedeposits", "params": ["currencyname"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

What are the arguments required for the `getreservedeposits` command?

The `getreservedeposits` command requires two arguments:

1. `"currencyname"` (string, required): the full name or i-ID of the controlling currency.
2. `"returnutxos"` (bool, optional): if true, returns a UTXO list and currency values on each.

getreservedeposits "currencyname" (returnutxos) Returns all deposits under control of the specified currency or chain. If the currency is of an external system or chain, all deposits will be under the control of that system or chain only, not its independent currencies. Arguments 1. "currencyname"    (string, required)    full name or i-ID of controlling currency 2. "returnutxos"    (bool, optional)     if true, returns a UTXO list and currency values on each Result:  {   "utxos" : {utxo and currency values},    if returnutxos == true, else null   "currency 1 i-address" : value,   "currency 2 i-address" : value,  } Examples: > verus getreservedeposits "currencyname" > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getreservedeposits", "params": ["currencyname"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/

What is the result format of the `getreservedeposits` command?

The result format of the `getreservedeposits` command is:

```
{
  "utxos" : {utxo and currency values}, if returnutxos == true, else null
  "currency 1 i-address" : value,
  "currency 2 i-address" : value,
 ...
}
```

How can I use the `getreservedeposits` command in Verus?

You can use the `getreservedeposits` command in Verus by running the following command in the terminal:

```
verus getreservedeposits "currencyname"
```

Alternatively, you can use the `curl` command to send a JSON-RPC request to the Verus daemon:

```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getreservedeposits", "params": ["currencyname"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
